page.title: 12RELIGION
page.content: {ST JOHN'S CHURCH AND SCHOOL-WINSFORD. The spire of St John's Parish Church Over can be seen for many miles. The church stands halfway along Delamere Street, with the recently built vicarage and community centre opposite it. The church foundation stone was laid in 1860, and it was built by Hugh Delamere, 2nd Baron, in memory of his wife. It was consecrated in 1863. The church serves a large parish, with many new houses being built in the last 30 years. The school was in existence for a number of years before the present building was erected. The old Over Market Hall was probably used. In 1858 Lord Delamere gave some land for a school to be built,and the first entry in the school logbook is June 1st 1863 The attendance was 91.Now in 1985 it has 85 on roll and a staff of 4.
